dict.acceptation: 膨胀；通货膨胀；夸张；自命不凡；

sent.orig: As inflation picks up, the liquidity boom and asset inflation draw to a close.
sent.trans: 随着通胀的加速，流动性增长以及资产暴涨将会逐步终结。

sent.orig: A one-off jump in commodity prices is not inflation. Nor a jump cause inflation.
sent.trans: 大宗商品价格的一次性跃升不是通胀，也不一定会引发通胀。

sent.orig: Bank of Japan pays attention to economy recession risk, consumer inflation expectation and inflation risk simultaneously.
sent.trans: 日本央行正在同时关注经济的下行风险以及消费者通胀预期和全球通胀上行风险。

sent.orig: One explanation is that other determinants of short-term inflation, particularly inflation expectations, have been flashing.
sent.trans: 一个解释是，其他短期通胀的决定性因素，特别是通胀预期已开始上升。

sent.orig: Like inflation, deflation also has a self-intensifying machinery. It goes even farther than inflation in harmfulness.
sent.trans: 它也存在着自我强化的机制，其危害性与通货膨胀相比，有过之而无不及。
